Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests] fix failing NetStandardReferenceTest on Windows" (#1470) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/index?buildId=1515010&tab=ms.vss-test-web.test-result-details

Since f7c942d, the NUnit tests have been failing on Windows. The
`NetStandardReferenceTest` is looking for `System.IO.Compression.dll`
inside the APK, but it is not there.

Looking into it, I don't see anything that explicitly needs
`System.IO.Compression.dll`, so perhaps we really don't need to assert
that this file exists.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Support D8 for dex file compilation" (#1469) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: D8 is now suggested dex compiler for Android development, with enhanced speed and reduced file sizes. We should aim to support D8 as the dex compiler.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add support for appt2" (#1468) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
We should migrate our build process to utilize aapt2 when available, leaving aapt as a fallback option for legacy support. 

https://android.googlesource.com/platform/frameworks/base/+/android-7.0.0_r7/tools/aapt2

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Unable to call Xamarin.Forms.Init from Android.App.Application" (#1467) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
According to Xamarin docs, Xamarin.Forms.Init is supposed to be called from an activity because it needs context, I was calling this in my main activity. However, we recently onboarded with Intune and our app now starts with a MAMApplication where this initialization needs to happen instead of main activity. The reason for that is that the intune sdk needs to refresh tokens periodically, for which it wakes our app in the background to refresh a token. When this happens, main activity is not triggered and according to their docs, Xamarin.Forms.Init should be instantiated in Application.onMAMCreate(). However, in order to do that initialization in Application class, I need context, for which I was calling global::Android.App.Application.Context, but this is null when apps are woken in the background. Please guide us on how to proceed when we need initialization to happen in the background. We cannot initialize Xamarin.Forms in an activity due to this error: 

03-16 12:04:06.763  2114 10980 E ActivityManager: Found activity ActivityRecord{ed4fba0 u0 com.ms.office365admin/md517ab7a70951959d26781e34f10adda95.MainActivity t4306 f} in proc activity list using null instead of expected ProcessRecord{b96ec4 7977:com.ms.office365admin/u0a102}
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: MAMServiceLookupThread
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime: Process: com.ms.office365admin, PID: 8413
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime: android.runtime.JavaProxyThrowable: System.InvalidOperationException: **You MUST call Xamarin.Forms.Init(); prior to using it**.
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:   at Xamarin.Forms.Device.get_PlatformServices () [0x00007] in <051840eae40a4636884ee6bc6a0d140a>:0
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:   at Xamarin.Forms.Device.GetAssemblies () [0x00000] in <051840eae40a4636884ee6bc6a0d140a>:0
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:   at Xamarin.Forms.DependencyService.Initialize () [0x00008] in <051840eae40a4636884ee6bc6a0d140a>:0
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:   at Xamarin.Forms.DependencyService.Get[T] (Xamarin.Forms.DependencyFetchTarget fetchTarget) [0x00000] in <051840eae40a4636884ee6bc6a0d140a>:0
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:   at Microsoft.Office365.Mobile.Admin.App.get_AuthenticationService () [0x00000] in <963848f09c164bfdbe61ae13c5ad2aaa>:0
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:   at Microsoft.Office365.Mobile.Admin.Android.AuthenticationCallback.AcquireToken (System.String upn, System.String aadId, System.String resourceId) [0x0001f] in <59a45af19f414c899cd8a0d64bcb71f3>:0
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:   at Microsoft.Intune.Mam.Policy.IMAMServiceAuthenticationCallbackInvoker.n_AcquireToken_Ljava_lang_String_Ljava_lang_String_Ljava_lang_String_ (System.IntPtr jnienv, System.IntPtr native__this, System.IntPtr native_p0, System.IntPtr native_p1, System.IntPtr native_p2) [0x00022] in <58b3e74d3cf0440b8ac5817d9c0df538>:0

03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:        at md517ab7a70951959d26781e34f10adda95.AuthenticationCallback.n_acquireToken(Native Method)
03-16 12:04:16.730  8413  8457 E AndroidRuntime:        at md517ab7a70951959d26781e34f10adda95.AuthenticationCallback.acquireToken(AuthenticationCallback.java:37)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Run android unit tests for result." (#1466) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello Team, I had a question regarding the [Test APK](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/blob/3f587f51b4bd36eab229069d7dce293659d8da62/Documentation/building/unix-instructions.md#running-individual-apk-projects) topic.

Is there a way to use the [`tests/RunApkTests.targets`](../../tests/RunApkTests.targets) and
[`build-tools/scripts/TestApks.targets`](../../build-tools/scripts/TestApks.targets)
files. so I can reuse the targets to run my own android unit tests and get results as part as our continuous integration?

I tried using the [NUnit Tutorial](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/xamarin/android/troubleshooting/questions/automate-android-nunit-test) with no success. I also created an issue [here](https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/xamarin-docs/issues/65) but I keep researching and found the targets there. 

I'd rather use these targets through a nuget package as opposed to manually downloading the target files and their associated files.

Any suggestions?
Thank you for your time!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Span Binding not updating even after OnPropertyChanged" (#2177) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Span Binding not updating even after OnPropertyChanged
### Steps to Reproduce

1. ViewModel with INotifyPropertyChanged
2. Bind Span inside formated text inside lable to a property
3. change the value of the property and call OnPropertyChanged

### Expected Behavior
the value updates
### Actual Behavior
the value stays the same
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.1.0.309646
- Last known good version:
- IDE: visual studio


@adamped Please check this one out since you did the #1850 PR for this

Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Removing docs" (#2174) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Removes local docs folders. Updates the readme to remove the docs step. Removes docs update batch script.

This change also creates placeholder files for 
`Xamarin.Forms.Core.xml`
`Xamarin.Forms.Maps.xml`
`Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.xml`
so that local nuget builds continue to work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "iOS - Running on device fails with MT0000: Unexpected Error" (#2176) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

When attempting to deploy to an iPhone 7 (iOS 11.2), the app deploys properly to the phone but the Visual Studio debugger detaches immediately after deployment and this error shows in the Output Window:

Launch failed. The app '[AppName].iOS' could not be launched on 'iPhone'. Error: error MT0000: Unexpected error - Please file a bug report at http://bugzilla.xamarin.com. Please check the logs for more details.

Note: I replaced my actual app name with [AppName] above.

### Expected Behavior

Deploys to phone and runs app with debugger attached.

### Actual Behavior

Deploys to phone and immediately detaches - app doesn't launch.

### Basic Information

Here is what I think is the relevant stack track from the Xamarin logs:

System.Net.Mqtt.Sdk.ClientPacketListener|Information|0|Client vs96644Jon - Dispatching Publish message to flow PublishReceiverFlow and topic vs96644Jon/error/xvs/idb/4.9.0.749/launch-app

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add support for Android bottom navigation bar in Xamarin.Forms" (#1400) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
The latest Material Design guidelines talk about a bottom navigation bar:
https://material.io/guidelines/components/bottom-navigation.html#

This is available within Android as the BottomNavigationView:
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/design/widget/BottomNavigationView.html

When can we expect to see this supported in Xamarin.Forms? Ideally, this would be available via the TabbedPage control, as suggested here:
https://forums.xamarin.com/discussion/84565/bottomnavigationview-option-for-tabbedpage-on-android

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[Android] Frame outline color not rendering" (#1347) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody: ### Description Migrated from https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=27460 The original issue was that the color wouldn't appear unless padding was set. In my sample I don't see the color on Android at all. iOS renders as I'd expect. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a Frame with an outline color. 2. Run and observe on Android the outline doesn't show the color. ### Expected Behavior The outline should be the color I've chosen, regardless of padding. ### Actual Behavior iOS renders as expected. Android outline isn't the chosen color, red. ### Basic Information - Version with issue: 2.5.0.121934 - IDE: VS Mac - Platform Target Frameworks: - iOS: 11.1 - Android: 7.1 running on 8.0 using FormsAppCompatActivity - Android Support Library Version: 25.4.0.2 ### Reproduction Link [Archive.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1539431/Archive.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[VisualStateManager] "Focused" does not behave correctly." (#2157) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

The common visual state "Focused" does not behave correctly.

### Steps to Reproduce

use Xamarin.Forms 3.0.0-pre2

```
<Entry Placeholder="IsFocused: true = Orange, false = Green" >
    <VisualStateManager.VisualStateGroups>
        <VisualStateGroupList>
            <VisualStateGroup x:Name="CommonStates">
                <VisualState x:Name="Normal">
                    <VisualState.Setters>
                        <Setter Property="BackgroundColor" Value="Green" />
                    </VisualState.Setters>
                </VisualState>
                <VisualState x:Name="Focused">
                    <VisualState.Setters>
                        <Setter Property="BackgroundColor" Value="Orange" />
                    </VisualState.Setters>
                </VisualState>
            </VisualStateGroup>
        </VisualStateGroupList>
    </VisualStateManager.VisualStateGroups>
</Entry>
```

### Expected Behavior

When Entry is focused it's BackgroundColor set to Green, and When Entry is not focused it's BackgroundColor set to Orange.

### Actual Behavior

When Entry is focused it's BackgroundColor set to Orange, and When Entry is not focused it's BackgroundColor set to Green.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0.296286-pre2
- Last known good version: nothing
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - all

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/P3PPP/CommonStatesFocusedReproduction

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[AppKit] Backport some NullAllowed fixes" (#3813) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "[XI]  ProtocolTest failure on device with Release with linkall enabled with d15-7 builds" (#3812) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and execute  monotouch-test on device with Release, linkall  and no llvm enabled


### Expected Behavior
Tests should execute successfully on device
### Actual Behavior
Protocol test in binding project is failing
[FAIL] ProtocolTest.OnlyProtocol :   [Protocol] IP1
[FAIL] ProtocolTest.ProtocolWithBaseType :   [Protocol] IP2
[FAIL] ProtocolTest.ProtocolWithBaseTypeAndModel :   [Protocol] IP3

This issue didn't occur in d15-6, seems to be a regression with d15-7.

### Environment

"
=== Visual Studio Community 2017 for Mac ===

Version 7.4 (build 1033)
Installation UUID: 74c37335-5878-4fa7-8f71-09bc48b661c5
Runtime:
	Mono 5.8.0.129 (2017-10/835a98d8559) (64-bit)
	GTK+ 2.24.23 (Raleigh theme)

	Package version: 508000129

	1.0.4

	2.0.0
	1.0.3

=== Xamarin.Profiler ===

Location: /Applications/Xamarin Profiler.app/Contents/MacOS/Xamarin Profiler

=== Xamarin.Android ===

	Supported Android versions:
		6.0 (API level 23)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[XI] App failed to launch on device with Dyld Message: Library not loaded: @rpath/libmonosgen-2.0.dylib" (#3811) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build and run monotouch-test on device with Debug and fast dev disabled. App runs successfully on device.
2. Build and run monotouch-test device with Debug and fastdev enabled.


### Expected Behavior
App should launch successfully
### Actual Behavior
App got installed but failed to launch. Device Log showed: 
Dyld Error Message:
Dyld Message: Library not loaded: @rpath/libmonosgen-2.0.dylib

Cleaning the solution fixed the launching issue.

### Environment

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[15.7] Binding project must use csc not mcs" (#3808) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Merged pull request "[Mtouch] Pass ShellExceute true in CopyMSymData. Fixes 3653" (#3809) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "[msbuild] Add msbuild test for #3791: Skip reference assemblies passed to mtouch" (#3810) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
See https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=53164.

Our msbuild tests are in fact still using `xbuild`. Because the test case in https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/pull/3791 is using NugetPackages added via "PackageReference" it needs msbuild. `xbuild` cannot "restore" nor is using the right `ResolveAssemblyReferences` target (that feeds csc with the right assemblies).

Adding the test itself once our tests are using msbuild should be trivial. It's just a matter of building the project with msbuild which will resolve the packages correctly.
